BCCAAD2E265A4BB69F470EAD7C9ED16F.description: Recite or sing a poem from memory.

92C195A9F639489ABD938424094C8BC3.description: Listen to poems to identify beauty or emotion.

6141E15372794D9181AA8C52A0C648FC.description: Discuss a variety of opinions regarding the structure, content, or source of information expressed in non-fiction texts.

4B6DFF4BB9774076879EECA298D3F789.description: Examine organizational structures of non-fiction texts.

59BAE5740D2546389B6EFDE24CAFB129.description: Describe characters based on what they say, think, or do or what others say and think about them.

1B3777FB4934488D92CF07C7498AA38E.description: Examine elements within a variety of fictional texts, including theme.

8090E9D91CCF4DCC916369A7B2FD5AF5.description: Examine a variety of fictional text structures, including flash-forward.

CCBDEA3036094EFA8565513379C081B8.description: Categorize texts according to a variety of fiction sub-genres.

4DDC2D5070354127835119B40FE94D91.description: Include a variety of text features to organize content and to identify information that is most important.

E3C131D6AC1F4187974F12969E0F0150.description: Examine a variety of text features that organize content and emphasize information that is most important.

6D3E58C6070D404C81E85F88952367D6.description: Develop reading stamina by engaging with text that is personally enjoyable.

3CD0248324294614925688D97EF107A9.description: Determine the form and structure of a variety of literary texts.

075D2E50835F4361B6D891F835AEFAA4.description: Engage with a variety of genres of literary texts.

5EA3CC3F3EE641E0A10418AB87805C63.description: Examine the purpose of a variety of digital or non-digital texts.

98AB266E2DE84B3DA026BEE46643C248.description: Meaning is derived through personal experiences with various features of land.

96D3998D69164026A635DECF1E41CA45.description: Drama is a literary form that can artfully express stories and ideas.

22C4A84D8BB047CF9AC62A8742A46756.description: Poetry can be experienced for its beauty and emotion.

722702CAD01048C7876EBB9FB88DC04A.description: Engaging with non-fiction texts can help to analyze the world through the eyes of others.

74D5AB15115849319AA1655FC9D25D37.description: Engaging with fictional texts can help to analyze the world through the eyes of others.

3291997AA9414B62856B62C2FF439AD1.description: Text features can help organize content and identify information that is most important.

8CE786D9BACA41E58DCA08ED3948932C.description: Text genres, forms, and structures can support the enjoyment and communication of ideas and information.

2ED7B218480F498A88BD8D847D6AB639.description: Land can be understood through personal connections to its features, such as living things in the natural world, human-made structures, patterns and cycles and stories of place.

FDEE8C4906354D63BCAC59923091CDCC.description: In dramatic works, ideas and information can be expressed through verbal, non-verbal, and paraverbal language.

D259524220CF4B3491B1C096E248357F.description: In dramatic works, plot and characters are developed through dialogue and action.

31FCDDE385BD452AB05C87A3766E8790.description: Dramatic works can activate the imagination and provide information about people in various times, places, and situations.

6A6FEC50172948608F6323649FE4547B.description: A stanza is a series of lines grouped together in a poem that relate to a similar idea.

D633B8BEA0D843BCAE78286335DF3EE3.description: Lyric poetry expresses personal emotions or feelings.

8049CC972BDF45D0ADA8869F84C7B526.description: Poetic structures include lyric poetry and stanzas.

3D790FCBF14A40858702AACD2C1A0ED1.description: Poetry can be experienced when it is read, listened to, or spoken.

1BB1CEA15915477185B2FC1A7376AF0C.description: Non-fiction texts can be examined to help the reader form opinions based on the structure, content, or source of information.

F78CA72412E54D1B968277A77DC4A23C.description: Structures within non-fiction texts include larger topics and subtopics and cause and effect.

B3F02E64CD0841EDBABE744EF3E4559F.description: Non-fiction texts include persuasive texts, such as editorials and opinion pieces.

7110DF342CAD4815A40836A405D7B024.description: Fictional texts can contain characters with multiple dimensions revealed by what they say, think, or do and what others say and think about them.

47E7D3EE384E4CD590D72584C4568B3C.description: A flat character does not change throughout a story.

2E00BC0FAF794A6485D5BED27C2F12C1.description: A round character is interesting and layered and may change throughout a story.

41692D6B3D1A4E32BC285B87850705F2.description: Types of characters include round and flat.

CEDC42BD5A1B4866B88F17EDFC83F025.description: Third person point of view is where the author or text creator is narrating a story about the characters, referring to them by name or using pronouns.

8FB5EA6C20E447C69213C32219A72E49.description: Elements of fiction include theme, the underlying message of a text.

C9F3290AFE4949F0A437B5C20C018D9A.description: A flash-forward interrupts the story plot to take an audience forward in time to events in the future.

D8EA66742CAB4331A0F4DB80B2FE2E0C.description: Fictional texts can have a variety of structures, including flash-forward.

5BDE8811C99C4CA6BFB6EFD7A01A9EEB.description: Science fiction is a modern fantasy text that describes technology, futuristic situations, and real or imagined scientific occurrences.

CE635B10A14E4363B98E834637DF18A5.description: A tall tale is an exaggerated folk tale that describes a central legendary character with extraordinary physical features or abilities.

82D012C7CDF4463C808F5CBDE274C7A8.description: Fiction sub-genres include science fiction, tall tales, and traditional literature.

E23506B0A70B46729EBD9EC920135DB7.description: Text features can be digital or non-digital and include sidebars and glossaries.

7AAFC998D904453D81F5FA4E177EB7F4.description: Narrative texts can be fiction or non-fiction and can be structured in a variety of ways, including beginning, problem, multiple events with many details, resolution of problem and ending.

EB60BAC42FB54FF5833531F7E3246F8F.description: Hybrid is a type of text that includes both fiction and non-fiction text forms.

CC5E2DE4302F4DBE8553BF20A5FC93F4.description: Literary text forms can be fiction or non-fiction and include photo essays, news articles and hybrids.

8A97633F2C4A46D19AC6CB486CDCAF6A.description: Reading stamina can be developed through engaging with text forms, genres, or structures that are personally enjoyable.

B2DC9E2E722349B5999585E436D8F9C3.description: Texts can have more than one purpose, including to inform, entertain, persuade and inspire.

DC0643F7B2F348C0AF3C5FF245BC8882.description: Texts can be digital or non-digital.

F097116E54094C969888131F14AE742A.description: Students examine how text genres, forms, and structures support and enhance communication.

4954AAA2DB684DD3BE15C46B5F333703.description: Text Forms and Structures: Identifying and applying text forms and structures improves understanding of content, literary style, and our rich language traditions.
